review_title: I genuinely like coming to work
years_at_company: I genuinely like coming to work
pros:
- get to work with very talented, dedicated people
- client base is impressive (Global 500)
- relaxed work environment (work from home as needed, etc.)
- travel is limited (about one trip a month)
cons:
- need to build as strong a culture in Chicago and London as San Francisco
- need a broader base of service offerings (beyond CPQ)
advice_to_mgmt: it would be nice if we could win some of the Friday games once in a while. just saying.

pros:
Engagement managers are extremely experienced, care about client success, and focus on consultant growth
Major projects to work on - Fortune 100 client base
Work from the office culture - you can be remote as needed, but there's typically critical mass in the office
Not a lot of standing on ceremony here; very collaborative, flat structure
Free snacks and drinks
Cool events from time to time
Smaaaaart people work here
Consultant-led committees that are actually able to make changes in the way our firm works and plays
We use Slack and it's amazing
We have the best technical minds and hands in the CPQ industry
Since I started here, I've had immense professional growth due to the opportunities this firm offers. I feel valued by the firm and my colleagues. I really like the people I work with and appreciate all the times we've saved the day for each other on shared projects.
cons: Looking forward to a more diverse firm as the years go by. Gender/ethnic diversity is a shortcoming at most tech companies, not just Pierce Washington. I have seen the diversity of the firm increase since I started, but it's still something that should be focused on and intentionally improved. If the majority of our hires are references, they'll typically share similar demographics to the person referring them. Diversity of experience, gender, and ethnic background makes us better, stronger, and smarter.
advice_to_mgmt: Trust your vision for the firm and for your projects, keep being tough with clients when needed, and keep talking to each other. You're our competitive advantage.

pros: Friendly working atmosphere. Skilled co-employees who offer their help whenever it is needed. It is perfect place to start your career with.
cons: Company is growing and it is trying to keep structure in place which I feel will improve over the years.
